str2: Neither, nor, not even, and not. From ou and de; not however, i.e. Neither, nor, not even.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To ignite, light, burn, lit. and met; I consume with fire. Apparently a primary verb; to set on fire, i.e. Kindle or consume.
A lamp. From the base of leukos; a portable lamp or other illuminator.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To put, place, lay, set, fix, establish. A prolonged form of a primary theo to place.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
A dry measure, nearly two English gallons. Of Latin origin; a modius, i.e. Certain measure for things dry.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
A lamp-stand. From luchnos; a lamp-stand.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To shine, give light. A primary verb; to beam, i.e. Radiate brilliancy.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.
